title: Rule #1 in Men of Action...Why Women's Words Can Be Misleading
description:
Ready to build a network of amazing women and high-status men?

Michael’s Men of Action is a one-on-one Master’s program that teaches men how to create elite social lives by becoming higher status.

Click this link to learn how you can have a High-Status lifestyle now:
https://m.moamentoring.com/podcast

Click here to join the Men of Action community and watch the High-Status Networking 101 course:
https://m.moamentoring.com/moa-community
————————————————————

Subscribe on Youtube: 
https://www.youtube.com/user/MichaelSartain

Listen on Apple Podcast: 
https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-michael-sartain-podcast/id1579791157

Listen on Spotify: 
https://open.spotify.com/show/2faAYwvDD9Bvkpwv6umlPO?si=8Q3ak9HnSlKjuChsTXr6YQ&dl_branch=1

channel_info.description:

transcription: {"text": "I use this example all the time. You talk to a beautiful woman and she keeps talking about how much she loves Alex the accountant and how Alex the accountant treats her like a lady and he opens her door for her and buys her flowers and how much she fucking hates Brock the bartender. He messages her in the middle of the night and where are you at and all this kind of stuff and you inevitably ask, did you have sex with Alex? No. Did you have sex with Brock? Yeah. You keep complaining about Brock, but you, I don't, wait, what, what? And then that's how you end up in the friend zone because you didn't keep that frame. You didn't keep those boundaries. Rule number one in MOA is we don't pay attention to people's words. We only pay attention to people's actions. I say this several times. I know it's offensive. Women vote with their bitch. When they say, I like this so much, they will go and sleep with the guy who they're actually attracted to, not the one they say they're attracted to. When you get over that and you start watching who are they becoming stimulated to, who are they touching their hair and literally turning their pelvis towards because of his behavior. And it's just one of these really.
